'Twas four o'clock in the afternoon, the time you start broiling things for dinner, and the lithe and slimy badger-lizards like corkscrews that make nests under sundials and live on cheese did go round and round like a gyroscope and make holes like a gimlet in the grass around a sundial that goes a long way before it, a long way behind it, and a long way beyond it on each side. All flimsy and miserable were the thin, shabby looking birds with feathers sticking out all round that are something like live mops, and the green pigs from here to home did something between bellowing and whistling with a sneeze in the middle.
